Package application

Class Plotter

  • java.lang.Object
    • application.Plotter
  • public class Plotter
extends java.lang.Object
    Controls a Canvas and plots things to it.
    Author:
    Jonathan Brose

    • Method Detail

      • plotFunction

        public void plotFunction​(Function function,
                         javafx.scene.paint.Color color)
        Plots the given function to the canvas in the given color.
        Parameters:
        function - the function
        color - the color, in which the function should be plotted

      • shouldBeSkipped

        private boolean shouldBeSkipped​(java.lang.Double functionvalue,
                                double x,
                                double x2,
                                Function function,
                                double distance)
        Checks whether the next line should get stroked or skipped.
        Parameters:
        functionvalue - newest function value
        x - x-coordinate in the coordinate system
        function - function which gets plotted
        x2 - x-coordinate which will come in the next iteration
        distance - the distance between one unit in pixels
        Returns:
        if stroking should get skipped true, otherwise false.

      • isValid

        public boolean isValid​(java.lang.Double d)
        Checks if d is a valid number (if it is infinite or Double.NaN)
        Parameters:
        d - value to get checked
        Returns:
        if the number is valid true, otherwise false.

        Parameters:
        curveDiscussionController - the curveDisscusionController
        color - color, in which the point will be plotted

      • plotAxes

        private void plotAxes​(double lineWidth,
                      javafx.scene.paint.Color color,
                      double distance)
        Plots the x and y axis.
        Parameters:
        lineWidth - the line width of the axes
        color - the color of the axes
        distance - distance between one unit in pixels

      • plotAxesLabeling

        private void plotAxesLabeling​(double lineWidth,
                              javafx.scene.paint.Color color,
                              double distance,
                              double commaSeperations,
                              double fontSize,
                              double maxValueWidth)
        plots the labeling for the x and y axes
        Parameters:
        lineWidth - lineWidth of the text
        color - the color of the labeling
        distance - a coordinate unit in pixels
        commaSeperations - how often the number should get split
        fontSize - the font size
        maxValueWidth - the max width a text can have

                      double lineWidth,

        Parameters:

        color - the color

        Parameters:
        points - the points which should get plotted.
        usedPoints - the points, that already where plotted.
        color - the color

      • wasPointAlreadyUsed

        private int wasPointAlreadyUsed​(java.util.ArrayList<Point> usedPoints,
                                Point point)
        Returns the number how often the point was used.
        Parameters:
        usedPoints - List with the used points
        point - point to get checked if a similar one is in the list
        Returns:
        how often the point was used.

      • calculateC

        private java.lang.String calculateC​(double c)
        Converts a double to a String in dependence on the scale.
        Parameters:
        c - value
        Returns:
        value as String, if the scale is greater than 1.7 the numbers after the comma are completely cut.
